explains: n. 学徒，徒弟；生手，新手

sentences.en: Bailly encouraged his young apprentice to learn to read and write.
sentences.cn: 贝利鼓励他的年轻徒弟去学习阅读和写作。

sentences.en: By age 15, he had become an apprentice to Sylvain Bailly, a well-known dessert chef with a successful bakery in one of Paris's most fashionable neighborhoods.
sentences.cn: 从15岁开始，他就成为了西尔文·贝利的学徒。西尔文贝利是一位著名的甜点厨师，在巴黎最时尚的街区之一有一家成功的面包店。

sentences.en: I started off as an apprentice and worked my way up.
sentences.cn: 我从学徒做起，然后一步一步做上来的。
